articles.title: Leak Hints at First Intel Nvidia Chip After $5 Billion Partnership
articles.mainIdea: Leak Hints at First Intel Nvidia Chip After $5 Billion Partnership
articles.summary: GuruFocus.com: Leak Hints at First Intel Nvidia Chip After $5 Billion Partnership. Intel (INTC, Financials) and Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) may be preparing to ship their first jointly developed chip, according to leaked details about a laptop processor called Serpent Lake. The leak, shared by YouTube channel RedGamingTec, suggests the chip will combine Intel CPUs with Nvidia RTX graphics in a single design. Serpent Lake is expected to pair Intel's upcoming Titan Lake CPU architecture with Nvidia's RTX Rubin graphics, manufactured on TSMC's 3-nanometer process. Related tickers mentioned: AMD, INTC, TSM.

articles.title: Uh-Oh! Did Nvidia Just Signal Problems with Intel’s Comeback?
articles.mainIdea: Uh-Oh! Did Nvidia Just Signal Problems with Intel’s Comeback?
articles.summary: 24/7 Wall St.: Uh-Oh! Did Nvidia Just Signal Problems with Intel’s Comeback?. Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) has experienced a dramatic shift in fortunes over the past year. Once viewed as a failing chipmaker losing ground to competitors like Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM), and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), Intel faced speculation that rivals were circling its foundry business and other assets. Duquesne Family Office's billionaire boss has jettisoned the faces of the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution in favor of a drugmaker whose shares have rallied 191% since the beginning of 2024.
